qas.question: Is there a test to determine asthma in an individual?

answers.text: There is currently no precise test

qas.question: What is diagnosis based on typically?

answers.text: pattern of symptoms and response to therapy over time
if there is a history of: recurrent wheezing, coughing or difficulty breathing

qas.question: What is used to confirm the diagnosis of asthma?
What age is too young to use spirometry to determine asthma?

answers.text: children under the age of six

plausible_answers.text: There is currently no precise test

qas.question: Is there a test to diagnose Spirometry?

plausible_answers.text: typically based on the pattern of symptoms and response to therapy over time

qas.question: How do you usually diagnose someone with Spirometry?

plausible_answers.text: if there is a history of: recurrent wheezing, coughing or difficulty breathing

qas.question: With what symptoms should you suspect a person has Spirometry?

plausible_answers.text: due to exercise, viral infections, allergens or air pollution

qas.question: When do symptoms of Spirometry get worse?

plausible_answers.text: children under the age of six

qas.question: What age makes it harder to be diagnosed as having Spirometry?
